intro: Tinnea zambesiaca, commonly known as the Zambesi tinnea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in woodland areas and is often found in regions with moist, well-drained soils. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds.
